IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Providing home, school, and therapy for kids who are at-risk.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Cookson Hills Christian School has been providing home, school, and therapy for kids who are at-risk, since 1957.
IRS990.Desc: We believe that every child needs a home that provides love, structure, and spiritual guidance. At Cookson Hills, kids move into a home with married houseparents (trained in trauma-informed care) along with house brothers and sisters. A healthy family where each child is a valued member is the best place to learn how to cooperate, love, and respect others.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: We believe that every child needs a quality education that can prepare them for success and a hopeful future. Our K-12th grade (ACSI accredited) Christian school, dedicated teachers, caring staff, one-on-one coaching, small class sizes, and trauma-informed care environment gives kids the opportunity to be understood and get back on track academically.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: We believe that every child needs the opportunity to heal from life's hurts. Our creative, faith-based, therapeutic services utilize mental health professionals, as well as equine experiences, to get to the source of the hurt and find healing.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The organization is a school as described under 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) and is not required to complete a public support schedule. Schedule A, Part II is completed to verify the School can qualify under public charity status section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and, therefore, qualifies to use the first listed special rule for Schedule B reporting.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10 Other Income
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION - OTHER INCOME, COLUMN A - 44898.0, COLUMN B - 59020.0, COLUMN C - 105937.0, COLUMN D - 136884.0, COLUMN E - 46699.0, COLUMN F - 393438.0; DESCRIPTION - INSURANCE PROCEEDS, COLUMN A - , COLUMN B - , COLUMN C - 307303.0, COLUMN D - 131870.0, COLUMN E - , COLUMN F - 439173.0;

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 Intended uses of endowment funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The primary investment objective of the quasi-endowment funds is to preserve the principal value and provide a predictable, stable income stream to accomplish strategic initiatives. Spending, other than for expenses directly related to maintaining and managing investments, is subject to board approval.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XI, Line 2(d) Other revenues in audited financial statements not in form 990
Schedule D, Part XII, Line 2(d) Other expenses in audited financial statements not in form 990
Schedule E, Part I, Line 3 RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A statement regarding our nondiscriminatory policy is in our promotional materials which are available to the public. It is also publicized on the homepage of the website at all times during the tax year in a manner reasonably expected to be noticed by visitors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 6(a) FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: State of Oklahoma Dept. of Commerce The school received funds as a part of the Oklahoma Schools COVID-19 Prevention Program.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Scholarships are required to be applied for each semester. Grades are reviewed to substantiate compliance with scholarship guidelines. Scholarships are applied to the student accounts and no cash changes hands.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Family Relations with Brandon Jackson, Treasurer/Director of Business Operations
Family Relationship with Ron Riley, Executive Director

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a Delegate broad authority to a committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The executive committee shall consist of the officers of the board of directors or others appointed by the President and shall meet upon call for purpose of performing urgent business that cannot wait for action of the Board. Any action of the executive committee shall be reported for ratification at the next meeting of the board. A simple majority of the board members of the executive committee shall constitute a quorum.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed by the Executive Director and the Treasurer/Director of Business Operations in detail. The 990 is then submitted to the board of directors for their review and approval. After approval by the board, the Form 990 is submitted for filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Although our policy states that CHCS does not transact business with board members, each board member and officer reviews and completes a Conflict of Interest Policy statement annually. The signed statements are reviewed by the Chairman. The Treasurer/Director of Business Operations also monitors transactions for conflict of interests through daily financial review. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director's performance and compensation is reviewed and voted on annually by the board of directors. The Salary & Benefits Survey of Nonprofit Organizations in the USA is used for comparability data. The process is documented in the Board minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director approves the compensation of the Treasurer/Director of Business Operations. Comparability data is used and the approval process is documented.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 11d Other Miscellaneous Revenue
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Other Revenue - Total Revenue: 46699, Related or Exempt Function Revenue: , Unrelated Business Revenue: , Revenue Excluded from Tax Under Sections 512, 513, or 514: 46699;

IdRelatedOrgTxblCorpTrGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: Hold assets for Cookson Hills Christian School Inc.
